programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Portugal is up against Czechia in Leipzig in Group F of EURO 2024. This is the fourth meeting at the EUROs. Czechia won 1-0 in the EURO 1996 quarter-finals and Portugal won 3-1 in the EURO 2008 group stage and 1-0 in the EURO 2012 quarter-finals.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Austria contests France in Düsseldorf in Group D of EURO 2024. Both major tournament meetings were at the World Cup. Austria won 3-2 after extra time in Turin in the 1934 round of last 16 and France won 1-0 in Madrid in the 1982 second group stage.

programme.title: 2024 UEFA European Championship
programme.desc: Belgium plays Slovakia in Frankfurt am Main in Group E of EURO 2024. This is the first competitive game between these nations. The most recent meeting was a 2-1 friendly win for Belgium in Bruges on Feb. 6, 2013 (90th-minute winner by Dries Mertens).

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: Brant has taken his new Camaro to his own shop while the 256 team works to build a Vega from stock.

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: After a terrible start to the racing season and a wreck that nearly blew up one of the team cars, the 256 pulls together to help Britt Berryhill rebuild the Bull, as a new team in town threatens to take their title as the fastest cars.

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: The 256 takes a young racer who is losing a lot this racing season and tries to turn him into a success at one of Alabama's biggest grudge race events.

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: A Chevy Caprice has the bones to become a flashy and fun donk car, but it's missing speed; Eric Malone, Brant Arnold and James Rowlett scheme to build a donk with a Triple F rating: flashy, fun and fast.

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: Brant Arnold recruits his 256 teammates to help rebuild local legend Jumping Jim Barnett's dilapidated 89 Camaro; they muscle the car back together, hoping to learn some of old Jims race-winning secrets.

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: Team member Dayne Hearn has a street-legal Camaro collecting dust, and mouse droppings, in his garage; it's going to need more than just a little cleanup; the 256 will need to upgrade the car with fresh parts and tune it up for a street-style track.

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: The 256 has a rusty old 1968 Impala that Brant and Eric believe can be a sleeper on the race track; with the Memphis 10 race approaching fast, they ask James Rowlett to lend a hand and convert this old family car into a bad-to-the-bones turbo.

programme.title: Fastest Cars in the Dirty South
programme.desc: The crew decides to help Eric's friend who was paralyzed in a wreck; They rebuild his car and add adaptive steering.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty's buddy Tommy has a '69 Camaro that needs some love, with damaged paint on the hood and malfunctioning headlight motors; another friend, T-bone, stops by with his '65 Impala for an air ride, updated interior and repainted steering wheel.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Shorty's friend Porkchop wants to turn a '69 Firebird convertible into a tribute Trans Am for his wife; Shorty and his team transform the car with a new spoiler, motor mods with AC and fuel injection, custom interior and custom racing stripes.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Arturo is a good friend of the shop, and his classic Nova will be a monster, with a rebuilt supercharged 6.2 LS, plus upgrades to the chassis and brakes; the crew revives a classic 1924 LaFrance fire truck for the nearby Cedar Hill Fire Department.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop

programme.desc: The owner (Ice Cube) of a barbershop faces pressure from a corporation that is opening establishments in his neighborhood.

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Hired to tame a rowdy Missouri bar, a Ph.D. bouncer (Patrick Swayze) romances a doctor (Kelly Lynch) and tames the whole town.

programme.title: Yes Man
programme.desc: After attending a self-help seminar, a negative-thinking man (Jim Carrey) brings about an amazing change in his life by saying yes to everything.

programme.title: Cujo
programme.desc: Bitten by a rabid bat, a huge dog traps a Maine woman (Dee Wallace) and her young son (Danny Pintauro) in their Ford Pinto.

programme.title: Missing in Action
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) escapes from the Viet Cong, then comes back with a floating arsenal to get others out.

programme.title: Fast Color
programme.desc: Hunted by mysterious forces, a woman with supernatural abilities must go on the run. With nowhere else to go, she goes back to her estranged family and the farmhouse she abandoned long ago.

programme.desc: Guided by a rebellious and charismatic coach (Hugh Jackman), British ski jumper Michael

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Following in his father's (Chevy Chase) footsteps, Rusty Griswold (Ed Helms) takes his wife (Christina Applegate) and two sons on a cross-country road trip to America's favorite fun park, Walley World.

programme.title: Obvious Child
programme.desc: An immature, newly unemployed comic (Jenny Slate) must navigate the murky waters of adulthood after her fling with a graduate student (Jake Lacy) results in an unplanned pregnancy.

programme.title: Music Within
programme.desc: After losing most of his hearing in the Vietnam War, Richard Pimentel (Ron Livingston) becomes a motivational speaker and a driving force behind the Americans With Disabilities Act.

programme.title: Missing in Action
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) escapes from the Viet Cong, then comes back with a floating arsenal to get others out.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Tormented by her peers and sheltered by her religious mother (Julianne Moore), an awkward teenager (Chloë Grace Moretz) unleashes her hidden, telekinetic powers after a sick prank at her senior prom pushes her over the edge.

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: A couple (James Brolin, Margot Kidder) battle a demonic presence in their new home, the location of many gruesome murders a year earlier.

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: The grown children of an overbearing Chinese matriarch reluctantly gather to take part in seven days' worth of traditional funeral rites.

programme.title: The Upside of Anger
programme.desc: An ex-ballplayer (Kevin Costner) befriends a mother (Joan Allen) of four who has hovered in a boozy funk since her husband abandoned her.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Family tensions arise after a woman (Nia Vardalos) falls in love with a man (John Corbett) who is not Greek.

programme.title: Elizabethtown
programme.desc: In Kentucky to bury his father, a troubled man (Orlando Bloom) gets his life on track with the help of a free-spirited flight attendant (Kirsten Dunst).

programme.title: Amy
programme.desc: Archival footage and personal testimonials present an intimate portrait of the life and career of British singer/songwriter Amy Winehouse.

programme.title: Never Goin' Back
programme.desc: Angela and Jessie are best friends intent on taking a wild beach trip, but when their roommate loses all of their money in a drug scam, the girls -- blissfully stoned -- go to increasingly daring and absurd lengths to get it back.

programme.title: Life After Beth
programme.desc: A guy (Dane DeHaan) discovers that his girlfriend (Aubrey Plaza) has returned from the dead, but his joy turns to horror as she slowly undergoes a horrible transformation.

programme.title: Pulling Strings
programme.desc: Rachel, a diplomatic consul, passes out on a street in Mexico City after a night of drinking. She is rescued by Alejandro, a single father whose visa she rejected the day before, and sparks fly between the two.

programme.title: Pulling Strings
programme.desc: Rachel, a diplomatic consul, passes out on a street in Mexico City after a night of drinking. She is rescued by Alejandro, a single father whose visa she rejected the day before, and sparks fly between the two.

programme.title: The Weekend
programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck comedian's vacation plans are interrupted by her ex-boyfriend and his new girlfriend.

programme.title: Philomena
programme.desc: Journalist Martin Sixsmith (Steve Coogan) helps Philomena Lee (Judi Dench) search for her long-lost son, who was taken from her by nuns in an Irish convent and sold into adoption when she was an unwed teenager.

programme.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
programme.desc: Worlds collide when Enn, a shy teenager in 1970s London, meets the beautiful and rebellious Zan at a party. They set in motion the ultimate showdown between their rivaling worlds and test the limits of how far they will go for true love.

programme.title: She's Out of My League
programme.desc: An airport security agent (Jay Baruchel) must figure out how to make the relationship work when a beautiful, successful woman (Alice Eve) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Backstabbing for Beginners
programme.desc: Based on a true story, an idealistic young employee at the U.N. investigates the grizzly murder of his predecessor -- uncovering a vast global conspiracy that may involve his own boss.

programme.title: Morris From America
programme.desc: A 13-year-old rapper (Markees Christmas) focused on hip-hop stardom falls for a rebellious classmate (Lina Keller) after moving from the U.S. to Germany with his widowed father (Craig Robinson).

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: Equals
programme.desc: Nia (Kristen Stewart) and Silas (Nicholas Hoult) begin a forbidden and passionate romance in a futuristic society where emotions have been outlawed, leading them to attempt a dangerous escape.

programme.title: Room
programme.desc: Held captive for years in an enclosed space, a woman (Brie Larson) and her young son (Jacob Tremblay) finally gain their freedom, allowing the boy to experience the outside world for the first time.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: A troubled Gulf War veteran (Denzel Washington) becomes suspicious after a powerful senator's (Meryl Streep) son (Liev Schreiber) becomes a candidate for vice president.

programme.title: Tears of the Sun
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL (Bruce Willis) and his squad try to protect a doctor (Monica Bellucci) and Nigerian refugees from ruthless rebels.

programme.title: A Glimpse Inside the Mind of Charles Swan III
programme.desc: A graphic designer (Charlie Sheen) plays out unusual fantasies in his head as a way of coping with the departure of his longtime lover.

programme.title: Don't Let Go
programme.desc: Detective Jack Radcliff gets a shocking phone call from his recently murdered niece Ashley. Working together across time, they race to solve the crime before it can happen.

programme.title: Woman Walks Ahead
programme.desc: A headstrong New York painter embarks on a dangerous journey to meet Sitting Bull but must face off with an Army officer intent on war with the Native Americans.
